As you can see, our Community is quite large.

<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconUsers.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconGlobe.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/universe.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconBook-small.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconBug.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconFridge-Small.png]]</nowiki>   <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/Iconaccessibility.png]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/IconArt-Small.png]]</nowiki>   {{http://www.ubuntu.com/files/u3/edubuntu_logo2.png|Edubuntu Team|width=150}}   {{http://www.ubuntu.com/files/u3/kubuntulogo2.png|Kubuntu Team|width=150}}   <nowiki>[[File:UbuntuStudio/Artwork/OfficialHardy/g20700.png|Ubuntu Studio Packaging Team|width=150]]</nowiki>

And that is just a ''small'' sample in no particular order.

You have just have taken your first step towards getting involved.  To find out the best way to get started, you should check out our community page at: http://www.ubuntu.com/community/.

Since this is a "community" maintained Wiki, you can <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WikiGuide | edit]]</nowiki> almost all of the pages on this site.  However, before you get started, we ask that you please observe the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/conduct|Ubuntu Code of Conduct]]</nowiki> at all times.

==== Help/Support ====

<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/stop.png]]</nowiki> '''''STOP'''''

Looking for ''user/help'' related documentation?  Sorry, but you are in the wrong place.  Please go to:

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com | Official Help Documentation]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/CommunitySupport | Community Support]]</nowiki>

Want to help create/develop/improve existing support documentation?  You've come to the right place.  Keep reading to learn how.

==== Editing this page ====

This Home Page is for the specific use as a landing Home Page for the Ubuntu Community's Team Wiki.  Regarding of whether you are at http://wiki.kubuntu.org or http://wiki.ubuntu.com, the documents are all the same; just different themes.

Currently, there are no SOPs for editing this page, so anyone can, and sometimes do, make changes to this page.

This current version is in response to <nowiki>[[Home-PageDiscussion]]</nowiki>.

===== Translations =====

If you are a member of a LoCo Team and would like this Home Page in your own language, you are certainly welcome to create your own version, but we ask that you please develop the translated version within your LoCo documents. 

'''Do not replace the contents of this page with any translations.'''

==== Get Involved ====

===== Teams =====

Looking for a team that falls under any of these categories, then your first stop should be our <nowiki>[[Teams]]</nowiki> page:

* Accessibility
* Artwork
* Community
* Distributions
* Hardware
* Marketing and Advocacy
* Quality Assurance and Packaging
* Software Developers
* Support and Documentation
* Training

The <nowiki>[[Teams]]</nowiki> page contains a listing of all the various Community Teams, links to their Wiki Home Pages (''and their websites''), and who the best person to contact is.

Most Teams' Wiki Home Pages provide information about who they are, what they do, when their meetings are, and how to contact them.  Using these pages, teammates are able communicate and coordinate with each other.

=== Governance and Processes ===

Like most communities, we have our <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/conduct | rules]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/processes | governing body]]</nowiki>.

===== Membership =====

Anyone can join and participate in most, if not all, of our Teams and Projects.  But if you want an ''"@ubuntu.com"'' e-mail address, it has to be earned.  Find out how in our <nowiki>[[Membership]]</nowiki> section.

=== Community Links ===

As an active member of our community, you probably should check out what else is going on in the world of Ubuntu:

* <nowiki>[[http://fridge.ubuntu.com | The Fridge]]</nowiki> posts all the latest News and Upcoming Events
* <nowiki>[[http://planet.ubuntu.com/ | Planet Ubuntu]]</nowiki> is a collection of community blogs

Or, you can help us <nowiki>[[http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/ | Brainstorm]]</nowiki> about how to make this a better OS for everyone.
